Shape (Overview / Examples »)

Shape

new Shape

The Shape Module/Contructor

Properties:
Name Type Description

supportedAttributes

 __list__ List of supported attribute names. In addition to the property names listed for DisplayObject, these are the attribute names you can pass to the attr() method. Note that this property is not available in your code, it's just here for documentation purposes.

Properties
Name Type Description
cap string The shape to be used at the end of open Path items, when they have a stroke. Can be one of 'round', 'square', 'butt'. Default: 'butt'
fillColor string The fill color. Default: black.
fill string Alias for fillColor
fillGradient string The fill gradient. Defaults: nothing
join string The shape to be used at the corners of paths. Can be one of 'miter', 'round', 'bevel'. Default: 'miter'
line string The line color. Default: transparent
lineWidth number The line width. Default: 0
miterLimit number The miter limit of the stroke. Default: 4
Returns:

A new Instance of Shape

Type
Shape

Extends

  • DisplayObject

Members

type

The type of the given instance.

clone

Returns a clone of the shape.

Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
cloneOptions Object <optional>
Properties
Name Type Argument Description
attributes boolean <optional>

Whether to clone attributes, not just segments.
Returns:

A shape with identical segments to the instance.

Type
Shape

closePath

Appends a segment at the end of the list of segments, which describes a close path.

Returns:

The current Shape instance

Type
Shape

curveBy

Appends an bezier-curve segment. Appends a segment at the end of the list of contained segments.

See:
  • Shape.curveBy

curveTo

Appends an bezier-curve segment. Appends a segment at the end of the list of contained segments.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
cp1x Number

first control point x
cp1y Number

first control point y
cp2x Number

second control point x
cp2y Number

second control point y
x Number

x-value of the point
y Number

y-value of the point
See:
  • http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html#InterfaceSVGPathSegCurvetoCubicAbs
Returns:

The current Shape instance

Type
Shape

getComputed

Returns dimensions/location of the shape

Parameters:
Name Type Description
key String

"size" for the full dimensions object or one of "top", "bottom", "left", "right", "width", "height"
Returns:

If you passed "size" as the key then an object will be returned, otherwise a number

Type
Object | Number

horizontalLineBy

Appends a segment at the end of the list of segments, which describes a straight line from the last Point to the given relative Point.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
x Number

relative x-value
Returns:

The current Shape instance

Name Type Description

absolute x-value

lastPoint

Returns the last point of the segments array or throws a warning if the segments array is empty.

Returns:

The last point of the segments array.

Type
Point

lastSegment

Returns the last element of the segments array or throws a warning if the segments array is empty.

Returns:

The last segment of the segments array.

Type
Array

Name Type Description

absolute y-value
Returns:

Type
Shape

morphSegmentsTo

Morphs segments to that of another shapes

Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
that Shape

The Shape to morph to (only segments will morph)
duration Number

The duration of the morph animation. Available formats are s (seconds), ms (milliseconds), _ (frames - no unit)
animOptions Object <optional>

Additional options to pass to the animation, e.g. {easing: ..., onEnd: function(){...}}

morphTo

Morphs segments to that of another shapes, along with other attrs

Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
that Shape

The Shape to morph to (all morphable attributes will morph)
duration Number

The duration of the morph animation. Available formats are s (seconds), ms (milliseconds), _ (frames - no unit)
animOptions Object <optional>

Additional options to pass to the animation, e.g. {easing: ..., onEnd: function(){...}}

path

Sets the segments of the Shape and returns the current Shape instance. Or returns a path representation of all the contained segments of the Shape when no parameter is given.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
path String

A SVG Path (http://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/paths.html)
Returns:

A path or the current Shape instance

Type
String | Shape

pointAtLength

Returns a point at a certain length

Parameters:
Name Type Description
length Number
See:
  • pathLength
Returns:

The x and y position

Type
Array

points

Sets the segments of the Shape and returns the current Shape instance. Or returns a copy of all the contained segments of the Shape when no parameter is given.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
param Array | Number

An array of points or a list of points
Returns:

An array of points or the current Shape instance

Type
Array | Shape
Example
myShape.points();
myShape.points(x,y);
myShape.points([x,y]);
myShape.points(x, y, x, y, x, y);

quadraticCurveBy

Adds a quadratic bezier curve to the shape. Coordinates are relative (i.e. relate to the end of the previous path segment).

Parameters:
Name Type Description
cpx number

x value of the control point
cpy number

y value of the control point
x number

x value of the anchor point
y number

y value of the anchor point
Returns:

the instance

Type
this

quadraticCurveTo

Adds a quadratic bezier curve to the shape. Coordinates are absolute (i.e. relate to the coordinate system of the shape).

Parameters:
Name Type Description
cpx number

x value of the control point
cpy number

y value of the control point
x number

x value of the anchor point
y number

y value of the anchor point
Returns:

the instance

Type
this

rect

Returns a new Shape instance with an rect.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
x Number

The x position of the rect
y Number

The y position of the rect
width Number

The width of the rect
height Number

The height of the rect
radius Number | Array

rounded corner radius or an array of radiuses for each corner, in the order top-left, top-right, bottom-right, bottom-left
Returns:

The current Shape instance

Type
Shape

segments

Sets the segments of the Shape and returns the current Shape instance. Or returns a copy of all the contained segments of the Shape when no parameter is given.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
commands Array

The commands
Returns:

An Array of segments or the current Shape instance.

Type
Array | Shape
Example
myShape.segments();
myShape.segments('moveTo', 0, 0);
myShape.segments(['moveTo', 0, 0]);
myShape.segments([ ['moveTo', 0, 0], ['lineTo', 10, 10] ]);

toCurves

Converts segments to absolute bezier curve instructions (curveTo)

Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
requiredCurves Number <optional>

Number of curves required

<static> arc

Returns a new Shape instance with an arc.

See:
  • proto.arc
Returns:

A new Shape instance

Type
Shape
Example
Shape.arc(75, 75, 75, 0, 2*Math.PI); // circle
Shape.arc(75, 75, 75, 0, 360); // circle TODO

<static> polygon

Returns a Shape instance containing a regular polygon.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
x number

The horizontal offset/translation of the polygon center.
y number

The vertical offset/translation of the polygon center.
radius number

The radius of the polygon
sides number

The number of sides of the polygon. Must be > 3
Returns:

A shape instance

Type
Shape

<static> rect

Returns a new Shape instance with an rect.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
x Number

The x position of the rect
y Number

The y position of the rect
width Number

The width of the rect
height Number

The height of the rect
radius Number

rounded corners
Returns:

A new Shape instance

Type
Shape
Example
bs.Shape.rect(0, 0, 150, 150);

<static> star

Returns a Shape instance containing a star.

Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
x number

The horizontal offset/translation of the star center.
y number

The vertical offset/translation of the star center.
radius number

The radius of the star
rays number

The number of rays of the star. Must be > 3
factor number <optional>

determines the star "pointiness". 0: all rays start at (0, 0) 1: the star looks like a regular polygon: 3 vertices are on a line. If omitted, a regular star is created
Returns:

A shape instance

Type
Shape

<static> toAbsolute

Transforms segments to absolute segments. i.e. lineBy->lineTo etc.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
Segments Array

array
Returns:

New absolute segments array

Type
Array
